Loose sheets in the health record: an administrative section and a medical section (vaccinations, development, any illnesses or malformations).

Collection of epidemiological data on health status (vaccination coverage in particular)

To be sent to the doctor in charge of the department's PMI service

question.title: What medical certificates are typically drawn up at 8, 9, and 24 months for compulsory systematic monitoring of infants?
question.description: For follow-up of normal infants, children and adolescents. Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing and dental abnormalities. Compulsory health examinations. School medicine. Child mortality and morbidity

option_a.title: Birth, 6 months, and 12 months medical certificates
option_a.description: A common approach to monitoring infant health, but not the correct answer

option_b.title: 8, 9, and 24 months medical certificates
option_b.description: The correct answer, as per the provided knowledge objective

option_c.title: 3, 6, and 12 months medical certificates
option_c.description: A plausible but incorrect option, as it doesn't match the 8, 9, and 24 months timeline

option_d.title: 6, 12, and 24 months medical certificates
option_d.description: Another plausible but incorrect option, as it doesn't match the 8, 9, and 24 months timeline
